isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LIFT AXLE SYSTEMS - FIXED (RIGID) AXLE ASSEMBLIES - REMOVAL

svcprocinfo.para: This section contains removal procedures for the fixed lift axle assembly and the components mounted on the fixed lift axle assembly. Removal procedures for the control panel mounted components are located in the CONTROLS section .

svcsubproc.title: AIR LINES - GENERAL
svcsubproc.para: Air lines can be detached from the quick-connect fittings as follows:

step1.para: Depress and hold the retaining collar where the line enters the fitting.
Pull the air line straight out of the fitting
Release the retaining collar.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT AXLE ASSEMBLY
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 14 while performing the following procedures.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Fixed Lift Axle Assembly Removal/Installation

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Remove the tires/wheels from the lift axle to provide clearance during removal of the mounting fasteners.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; support the lift axle to remove strain from the mounting points and to prevent sudden movement once the lift axle is free.

step1.para: Support the lift axle assembly to prevent it from dropping when the mounting fasteners are removed.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect and label all supply and control air lines from the lift axle assembly .

item.para: supply line to axle mounted tank (at tank)
brake control line to axle mounted brake relay valve (at valve)
supply line from axle mounted solenoid to pressure regulator (at solenoid)
delivery/control line from pressure regulator to load bag quick release valve (at valve)

step1.para: Disconnect electrical connection to the lift axle solenoid.

Remove the mounting hardware securing the lift axle assembly to the vehicle frame (both sides). If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Lower and remove the lift axle assembly.

svcsubproc.title: LOAD BAG
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to FIGURE 14
while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
If it will help provide access, remove the tire/wheel from the side of the lift axle with the defective load bag.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Using a jack, raise and support the lift axle assembly at its normal ride height.
Disconnect the air line at the fitting on the load bag.
Remove the air line fitting for transfer to the replacement bag.
Remove the mounting hardware (nut and washer) securing the bag air stem to the top mounting plate.
Remove the bag mounting hardware (bolts and washers) from under the bottom mounting plate.

note.para: To perform the following step it may be necessary to loosen the mounting bolts securing the bag's upper mounting bracket.

step1.para: Remove the remaining mounting hardware (bolt and washer) securing the bag to the upper mounting plate.
Remove the load bag. Retain all mounting hardware for use with the replacement bag.

svcsubproc.title: LIFT BAG/LIFT BAG QRV
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 15 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.

note.para: Before performing the next step, check the areas around the lift bag to determine which direction provides the most clearance for bag removal.

step1.para: If necessary to gain access, remove the tire/wheel from the side of the lift axle with the defective lift bag.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect the air line at the fitting on the lift bag QRV (item 3), located at the rear of the lift bag.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Fixed Lift Axle - Side View

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. LIFT BAG QUICK RELEASE VALVE AND QUICK CONNECT AIR FITTING

step1.para: Remove the QRV (with air line fitting) for transfer to the replacement bag.

note.para: The lift axle must be in the lowered position to gain access to the front of the lift bag.

step1.para: At the front end of the lift bag, remove the mounting hardware (item 2) used to join the lift bag to the lift axle swing arm assembly.
Remove the mounting hardware securing the bag air stem to the rear mounting plate.

note.para: If necessary, the lift axle may be raised with a jack to allow removal of the lift bag.

step1.para: Remove the lift bag. Retain all mounting hardware for use with the replacement bag.

svcsubproc.title: QUICK RELEASE VALVE FOR LOAD BAGS
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 16 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Bleed all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the quick release valve (item 13).
Remove the mounting hardware (bolts, nuts and washers) securing the quick release valve to its mounting bracket.
Remove the air line fittings from the defective valve for transfer to the replacement valve.

svcsubproc.title: FULL FUNCTION RELAY VALVE (BRAKES)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 16 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the system.
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the relay valve (item 12).
If necessary, remove and label any air lines from the axle mounted quick release valve (item 13) that will interfere with the removal of the relay valve.
Remove relay valve from air tank and separate the air line fittings for transfer to the replacement valve.

svcsubproc.title: PRESSURE PROTECTION VALVE
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 16 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the system.
Disconnect and label the air line connected to the valve (item 15).
Remove pressure protection valve from air tank and separate the air line fittings for transfer to the replacement valve.

svcsubproc.title: FIVE PORT VALVE/SOLENOID
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 16 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the system.
Disconnect electrical connection to the solenoid (item 10).
Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the solenoid.
Remove the two solenoid mounting bolts from the front of the mounting plate.
Remove solenoid and separate the air line fittings for transfer to the replacement solenoid.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE MOUNTED TANK
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 16 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Drain all air from the system.

note.para: Lift axle should be in the lowered position.

step1.para: Disconnect and label all air lines connected to the axle mounted tank (item 4) and all remaining tank mounted components/valves (brake relay valve, item 12; and pressure protection valve, item 15).
Remove brake relay valve from the air tank.
Remove the pressure protection valve from the air tank.
Remove clamping bolts from tank mounting straps.
Carefully spread the tank mounting straps and remove tank from the axle assembly.
Remove the air line fittings and drain cock from the tank for transfer to the replacement tank.

svcsubproc.title: BRAKE MECHANISM
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Group 04 BRAKES in the Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: AXLE SEAT BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 15 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Remove the tires/wheels from the lift axle.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; support the axle to remove strain from the mounting points and to prevent sudden movement once the axle is free.

step1.para: Support the axle to prevent it from moving when the mounting fasteners are removed.

Remove the mounting hardware (item 4) securing the axle seat assemblies to the swingarm (both sides). If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Raise the axle, and attached axle seats, to allow access to the bushings.
Remove all four bushings from the swingarm and retain any hardware for use with the replacement bushings, if necessary.

svcsubproc.title: ARM PIVOT BUSHINGS
svcsubproc.para: Refer to FIGURE 15 while performing the following procedures.

step1.para: Install wheel chocks.
Remove the tires/wheels from the lift axle.
Drain all air from the lift axle system.
Disconnect the mounting hardware securing the swingarm to the front of the lift bag, to allow greater movement of the swingarm.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or possible death; support the axle swingarm to remove strain from the pivot points and to prevent sudden movement once the swingarm is free.

step1.para: Support the swingarm to prevent it from dropping when the mounting fasteners are removed.

At the swingarm pivot points, remove the mounting hardware (item 1) securing the swingarm to the hanger rails (both sides). If Huck fasteners are used, remove the Huck fasteners using an approved method. Refer to Service Section S01001Y, Group 01, in the Master Service Manual for the approved removal methods.
Lower the front of the swingarm to allow access to the bushings.
Remove both bushings from the swingarm and retain any hardware for use with the replacement bushings, if necessary.
